document.discussion_title: H&T Group Plc (HAT) Downgraded by Numis Securities Ltd to Hold
document.topic_text: Tweet Numis Securities Ltd downgraded shares of H&T Group Plc (LON:HAT) to a hold rating in a research report released on Tuesday. The brokerage currently has GBX 320 ($4.12) price target on the stock. Shares of H&T Group Plc ( LON:HAT ) opened at 300.00 on Tuesday. H&T Group Plc has a 52 week low of GBX 180.00 and a 52 week high of GBX 312.06. The stock’s market cap is GBX 108.46 million. The company’s 50-day moving average is GBX 282.57 and its 200 day moving average is GBX 234.43. The company also recently announced a dividend, which will be paid on Friday, October 7th. Stockholders of record on Thursday, September 8th will be issued a GBX 3.90 ($0.05) dividend. This represents a dividend yield of 1.37%. The ex-dividend date of this dividend is Thursday, September 8th. Separately, FinnCap reissued a buy rating and set a GBX 320 ($4.12) price objective (up from GBX 220 ($2.83)) on shares of H&T Group Plc in a research report on Tuesday, August 16th. H&T Group plc is a United Kingdom-based non-trading holding company. The Company operates in six segments: Pawnbroking, Gold purchasing, Retail, Scrap, Personal Loans and Other services. The Pawnbroking segment is engaged in providing secured loans against collateral (the pledge). The Gold Purchasing segment is involved in buying Jewelry directly from customers through its stores. H&T Group Plc H&T Group Plc
